reviewText: I watched this movie over Christmas with my family in Canada. I am not typically a western movie lover (only a few I really like) but liked this movie for it's humorous spin on a typical western. The whole family greatly enjoyed the movie from the oldest (my eighty-eight year old grandmother was laughing so hard she was crying) to the youngest (twelve year old boy). I definitely would recommend this movie for good laughs for the whole family.
Such a great movie!! Fun and with so many important ideas about who we are and who we can be. One of Paul Gross's finest moments on camera.

We purchased a used copy of "Gunless" and it was perfect, except in one spot in the movie there was three hesitations in a row, but we are still very pleased to own this great, funny movie, and getting it at a great price!
absolutely funny movie!
Funny movie. Company delivered on time, itemwas as discribed. Dependable!
LOVE IT. VERY FUNNY

Great sleeper of a movie.  Saw it for the first time on Netflix, and had to buy it.  It was continually recommended, and although it took nearly a month, I finally gave in.  I wasn't disappointed.  The writing and casting were spot on.
Mildly entertaining, but overall kind of dumb.  Really dumb in the beginning but gets a littler better as it goes on, i like Paul Gross but in my opinion this isn't one of his better movies.
not worth watching

This movie is a bit tongue and cheek. The characters are somewhat corny and I think you will thoroughly enjoy it if you just watch and don't
judge. It's a good entertaining movie and clean. Family friendly for the most part. There is nothing standard about this western. The line you
will hear throughout the movie is "What is wrong with you people".
Great movie
Clever plot and likeable characters. Not your average western.

I watched it about five years ago on Canadian TV and now would like to see it again ... many laughs, some bits of violence, original fresh story line, tongue in cheek western parody full of memorable characters well directed -- a truly unique movie triumph in a class of its own.

Nothing else quite like it -- before or since!
Cute movie, but better to rent than own.
Great Western movie filmed in Canada with good clean action and hero gets the girl.
Excellent movie! We had watched for free on Netflix and your price was great. Now we can watch it whenever we feel like it.
I love this movie
This movie immediately became my favorite funny Western, a position formerly held by "My Name Is Nobody". I have recommended it to everyone I know who watches Westerns.
I have seen this movie before and wanted to buy the DVD.  You can't see it on On-Demand or Netflix.  Clever plot, well-acted.  Cute movie.
ok

This is a very clever, well-acted movie. It's kind of a weird, quirky, The Man With No Name meets Anne of Green Gables way. It's a really fun story of a clash of two very different cultures, and it's innocent enough for the entire family to watch. WARNING: The movie itself is really very clean, but the outtakes in the end credits contain some vulgar language, including the F-word. If you want to keep it PG, stop the video when the end credits roll.

One of my favorite movies of all time. An underrated little comedy gem. Movies like this don't come around often enough. The cast and the script are both fantastic. Its simple and sweet...with no part of it overdone, like most Hollywood films. Its a movie a have to watch every few months.

Paul Gross is probably underrated in the United States but he deserves to be on our 'A' list.  I love westerns and have had many favorites including Rooster Cogburn.  Gunless is my new favorite by far, a great family movie and all the flavor of what a western should be. I have given a number of my friends this movie as a gift.  Would be a great movie for a sequal.
Good service, happy customer
Ridiculous story and teh acting is very odd.
One of our favorite movies. =)
Funny movie.  Paul Gross is very good as a comic actor.
Any Paul Gross fan should enjoy this movie. While somewhat predictable in plot, it was still an enjoyable movie with a wonderful cast and acting.
Interesting movie starring Paul Gross. First saw him in Due South - a fun quirky excellent series. Now watching him in Slings and Arrows which is addicting! This movie is different and I liked it.
STUPID, WOULD LOVE TO RETURN IT, BUT WONT
liked the movie and product arrived in good shape
Very funny and lighthearted, even with the serious issues. Bloopers are great.
Very Funny movie. Good Family entertainment. Truly a sleaper.
Not a lot of action, silly at times
I liked the movie, but was disappointed there were no subtitles.  My hearing isn't what it used to be, and I had a hard time understanding what some of the characters were saying.
Great acting, great writing, great fun!
Funny movie!!  Very entertaining!!!
Pretty silly movie. Has some humorous parts. My nephew loved it, but it is not my cup of tea!
This is a great sleeper you never heard of. The cast is perfect and the characters are hilarious! After watching it on Netflix many times, I finally had to buy it.
Family friendly movie,nothing to shock just entertaining!
A lot better than I expected. Fun and sweet.
Excellent movie, it is hilarious, i think there only one cuss word (and it's not the F word) in the entire movie, no GRAPHIC violence, and no nudity.  So don't let the rating concern you.

I do like Paul Gross as an actor.  If you have watched Due South, you will get a lot of the nods to that program. Even the bad guy is played by Callum Keith Rennie ( Ray Kowalski in Due South). A little predictable, but watchable.
Enjoyed it very much!

This is a very funny western.  I had watched it on Netflix and laughed so hard.  I went back to watch it again, and it was removed, so I bought it.  If you like westerns, you will love it.  If westerners aren't your favorite type of movie...You will still like it.  In the opening scene a big burly cowboy arrives in town riding his horse backwards.  Then you notice the rope around his neck and hands tied up ...and he is dragging a tree branch behind the horse.  He is a big tough hombre who is looking for a fight, but nobody will fight him...they just don't take him seriously.
Good movie
Already did this....Wonderful movie!!!!!!!

Great movie.  for once it was nice to sit down and enjoy a movie the had no bad language, half nude people running around, no
sex scenes, or bloody body parts flying around.  This was a good clean movie with some humor thrown in.  And of course I always
like a happy ending.  And I really liked the part where Paul Gross twirls the gun around his fingers.  That was amazing how he did
that. (wonder how long it took him to practice that bit.) Great, Great movie!
Great movie!
Loved this movie and  had to replace it.  It sort of grew legs and walked out the door.
This is hilarious. Paul Gross is as good as he was in Due south.

Kind of stupid, but funny throughout.
It does make one wonder how any of these people managed to survive as long as they did.
From a misguided gunslinger with a warped sense of right and wrong;  the people of a small Canadian town, who all seem to have been fathered by "The Three Stooges;" the bounty hunters, who don't know their business; and the RCMP, who seem to be Boston Brahmins at boy scout camp during summer vacation.
The only sensible person in the whole film is the Indian scout attached to the Mounties, who seems to be wondering "What is it about these white people?".
I was left with having no idea whatsoever about what this film was trying to accomplish.
The previews for it ( on other dvds I have purchased ) were far better than the whole film.
Funny!
This is my favorite movie ever! Netflix removed it and so I went shopping and found it here and could not pass up the price.

I like this movie because it's different than many westerns.  Funny and entertaining.  Good interaction between the cast...good dialogue and good delivery.  It's corny to be sure, but that's part of its charm IMHO.
Very funny
Love the movie
one of my favorite movies I must have watched it 20 times so far. never heard of the cast but they were good.
great movie
this show is so funny and cute at the same time love it
Very funny, offbeat "western". Characters are all well played by actors not particularly well known. Subtle in places, laugh out loud funny in others. A unique and entertaining movie.
Very entertaining.
great movie,funny

Every once in awhile I come across a seriously funny  but believable film; this is my latest. Take a gunman from the west and deposit him in a VERY small Canadian town with colorful characters, great actors and good dialog and let the fun begin! I can easily watch this once a month.
LOL Canadian Comedy!  Watched this on a flight to the Canadian Rockies & loved it!
Paul is funny as usual.  He's not the overly clean Dudley Do-Right character from Due South in this one.
pretty good movie.

I enjoyed this movie. I am a long time fan of Paul Gross and am not completely estranged from the western genre, so I was pleased but not surprised to find that this is a good movie. It would be suitable for most ages I believe. There is some, but very little, cursing in the dialogue. So, if anyone reading this is interested in a family friendly, Canadian western, I have no problem fully recommending "Gunless."
Loved it - it was hysterical.  Gross is a wonderful actor.
Love this movie! Funny, fun, thoughtful.
This is a great movie. Paul Gross does an excellent job as does the rest of the cast. Somewhat serious, lots of humor.
Liked this movie a lot.

This is a fun western in Canada where NO ONE has guns, except one and he stands out like a sore thumb. It's really different of today's movies and refreshing. You'll have to see this for yourself. Don't pick at it for faults just enjoy it.

This film is a quite different take on the traditional Western genre.  The cultural differences between US and Canadian views of how to live a good life emerge.  Paul Gross is engaging and multidimensional as The Montana Kid, stuck in an environment that challenges his basic assumptions of honor, courage and friendship.  The supporting cast is strong as well.  It will make you think about a lot of things about your life.

Paul Gross is always fun to watch in comedies (Due South) and he does a fine job in this one as a American gunfighter who is being chased by an outlaw gang and flees to a small Canadian town where the people are so darn polite and no one carries a gun.  The short tempered gunfighter calls out the local blacksmith and finds not only does he not have a gun, no one does.  A beautiful local widow has a broken one and offers it to him if he works it off on her farm.  Gross is excellent as the frustrated gunfighter who can't seem to figure out what's going on around him.
Such a great movie! Lots of action and very funny. I have only had the movie a couple of weeks...and have watched it at least three times. And I'll be watching it again and again!

This one heck of an entertaining movie! Dialogue full of dry humor, good acting & directing. The only part of it that seemed unnecessary was the Montana Kid  momentarily in bed with the heroine, but other than that the movie was hugely enjoyable..
I ordered this for my husband and he loved the movie.  Arrived on time and no problems with the video.
even my stoic husband laughed out loud during this movie!  It's clean and fun.  Oddball characters in a Canadian Prairie town populate this fun movie. and Paul Gross is gorgeous even filthy dirty!
i just love this tape so must it is great i just love to watch it thank you so must
this was a gift for my parents. They love good, clean, funny movies an well hey if they like it i love it :) ha!
"Leave your gun at home, son, don't take your gun to town." A man foolishly gives up his gun at his girlfriend's request, but he still wins against the baddies.

Saw this on Netflix a week or so ago, and was totally blown away...it's funny, well shot (no pun intended!), touching, exciting, and just plain fun. Loved it so much, I ordered the Blu-ray for myself, and the DVD for my 87 year-old dad, who I KNOW is going to love it, too. Currently the DVD on Amazon is less than $4.00, so trust me, take the risk and you'll be glad you did. It's good clean fun (all except, as someone else mentioned, for the closing credits, where they show out-takes with a lot of swearing...guess they felt they'd seem more hip that way...but there's absolutely nothing within the movie itself like that!).  It's a real gem, and I'm lucky I managed to notice it when I did...

After reading a short synopsis of the movie -- American gunfighter strays across the border into Canada, and finds the native not that interested in gunfighters -- I had to see the movie. It is a gem, filled with dozens of standard Western tropes that turn out quite different from the norm. There are bad guys, good guys (in white hats, no less), fist fights, Chinese laborers, saloons, a hardscrabble farm, etc., presented in an entirely original context.

Loved it. Recommend it for all NRA meetings.
Odd story my wife loved Paul Gross fans will love this comedy/drama. Buy it used as you will only watch once
A very funny western with a cast of virtual unknowns.  I enjoyed every minute of this Canadian production.  Highly recommended

This is a comedy western movie by London import Sienna Guillory who delivers a hilarious performance. I quickly fell in love with this movie,I'm a huge fan of this great actress and she will not disappoint anyone else who has taken her to heart. Grab it....
great fun for Paul Gross lovers.  we have been fans of Gross ever since Due South (which of course we bought from amazon)
great characters. great chemistry. fun story. a surprise gem I happened across a while back that we have watched over and over again.

I have to start by saying I love Paul Gross.  I loved him Due South and am a huge fan of Slings and Arrows.  I bought this for giggles and was glad I did.  It is a very nice family movie with enough depth to engage my appreciation as an adult.

I could have done without the long hair on Paul Gross, but without it & the constant mumble-speak, he wouldn't have  been able to pull off the kind of character that he was trying to play. His abrasive, World weary gunman is a novelty in a town where
kindness & compassion abound. Slowly he begins to see the senselessness of the code he lives by, with predictable results. I was surprised that the story didn't try to glamourize gunfighting. As for objectionable content: there is a scene where a bad guy shoots a boy's dog (to show the people he means business)& there is a brief scene with an unmarried couple waking up next to each other,but otherwise there is no sex & little if any objectionable language. No one you like dies & the ending is predictable,but is that a bad thing ?
The background music was a little bit distracting ( same song repeated a few times throughout the movie) but the scenery was spectacular . Not a block buster but still it is a decent movie

A WONDERFUL ROLE FOR GROSS. EXCELLENT DEADPAN COMEDY. REMENISCENT OF THE TERENCE HILL'S MOVIES
IN THE " LUCKY LUCK " CHARACTER. FUNNNNN!!!!
We love this lighthearted movie.  It has a great message and the characters were perfect for their parts!  The scenery and music were great too.  We would recommend it to any family.
Was really surprised how good this movie really was. If someone is thinking about whether they should get this movie.  Let me say, "Try it, You'll like it."

I hadn't heard of this film until it showed up on my movie channel.  Since I saw only a part of this funny redemption story, I wanted to see it all. I haven't giggled through any comedy in a long time, and this one had me reaching for the tissue box I was laughing so hard.  Several viewings later, I'm still delighted with this Canadian film.  Need a lift for your spirits today?  This movie just might help you out.

What a breath of fresh air to see a modern western that isn't so bleak and serious.  Almost the entire movie plays through without a gunshot, knifing, rape or even any bad language.  The odd mix of characters offset by Paul Gross' portrayal of a gunfighter running from mostly himself allows for lots of subtle and witty comedy.  A 5 star movie I'm happy to have found.

Having seen Paul Gross in the series, Due South, I was expecting much more of this movie.
It was a strange movie, and I lost interest part way through and never even finished watching
it. I expected humor, and couldn't find any. I expected an interesting plot, and it just wasn't there.

I have recently become reacquainted with Paul Gross, 20 years after his "due South" series on CBS in the US, so decided to try to find more productions he's been involved with.  The price on "Gunless" was just right, so I knew there'd be no serious loss if I didn't like it.  Well, blow me down!  It is hilarious, and since I often have children in the mix for family movie night, it was important to me that it is refreshingly clean and innocent, too (I do, however, eject the DVD when the credits roll with the rather bawdy outtakes).

The Montana Kid turns out to have engineering skills, and while waiting for a gunfight to materialize, he works on repairing a broken-down old pistol and helps a ranch owner improve her life (and her spread) by hooking a windmill up to her well.  A relationship of a rather amusing adversarial nature develops, each making the most of the other's flaws, but they have ample opportunity to see each other's strengths, too.  The gunslinger sees a tiny town of good, happy, quirky citizens, and because he's understandably tired of the killing and running, the entire picture starts to look pretty attractive to him.  He ponders making a better life.

Canadians and Americans generally come from the same British stock and history, but the southern branch of the family tree often seems brash and considerably less civilized.  This film gives us the chance to know, enjoy, and love our wacky northern cousins. They, of course, think we're pretty wacky, too.

The delivery was perfect and I appreciate the speed with which it arrived.  And, this movie is very funny!  It's extremely underrated.  I'm thinking of purchasing another one for the hard to buy for person on my Christmas list.
This is the best cowboy movie.  It is a comedy, but it is extremely clever comedy ...not goofy.  It is a good romance with plenty of manly stuff for a man to enjoy too.
This is one of my favorite movies now.  I saw it on netflix and decided to buy it.  Great humor.
Love Paul Gross. Funny story with great characters and lots of laughs. Good family movie. One that you will use the lines at family functions.
Absolutely hilarious!  Quirky Canadian humor full of references you either get or you don't.  We laughed out loud.  Clean (except for the bloopers)
This is one &^%#$ funny movie. Great writing. Great acting. Lots of tongue in cheek funnies mixed in with some good old fashioned sight gags. Worth every penny.

Loved this movie. Very funny!

On a political note, after going through whole the movie deriding the use of guns, everyone whips one out in the end to stop the bad guys!
This is a movie just to be entertained on a evening. Not a classic by any means, but you get a few laughs.
Tongue in cheek, clever, and well acted. This is a hoot as the Canadian's take a jab at American gunfighters.

I watch this movie whenever I need a 'lift'!  It is fun, entertaining, and hokey!!  They must have had a great time making this film.... Paul Gross is just great with his expression and 'would-be-bad-guy' impressions!!  Not enough time to develop all the characters, but it still 'works'..... in the end, you know just who everyone is on the inside!  Good job.... great fun.
That's all we got this for...we're Paul Gross fans from his DUE SOUTH days. You judge it yourself....others can't tell you what you'll like or not.

It was a fun movie and kept you guessing where it was going. There was a lot of humor to it, yet it didn't move into the silly category that a lot of western comedies tend to do. You develop the ability to relate with the characters, and still it doesn't get too sappy. Overall, a good enjoyable movie for those who enjoy the character developed by Paul Gross.
This is a very enjoyable movie and I have recommended it to many people.  It is very witty and cleverly done.
Cute, funny movie. The gags are amusing, the ending stuff is kind of predictable but that's how it is with most movies.

A quirky, neat, family-friendly story. Well executed and acted. Paul Gross, as the protagonist, pulls off the part with aplomb! He demonstrates appropriate belligerence, slowly becoming acceptance as the story unfolds. Well done!

This movie, while a bit slow at times, has a good mix of subtle and not so subtle humor throughout.

Think of it as western outlaw meets civilized Canadian frontier. Tons of humorous opportunities there... and they included a bunch.

This is one of my top 5 movies! There isn't a ton of action which you won't miss but the acting is great, it's funny, and it's clean (accept for the credits at the end). It's a simple movie with jaw dropping Canadian scenery. Paul Gross is perfect as The Montana Kid with the rest of the acting crew right up along there with him.  I don't know who did the casting but the chemistry among all the actors is noticible - you can tell they had fun making it. You may not love this movie as much as I do but you will at least like it. I'd have given it 6 stars but it didn't go on forever so I gave it 5. I hope you enjoy it.

Paul Gross is wonderful in this movie!  I love the gentleness of the whole movie and the more realistic view of the Old West!  My sister laughed so hard we had to stop the movie!  I will watch this one many times!
I really wish this would have been made into a series.  Its a great bit of fun with the old westerns and I laugh each time I watch.  Reccomend it to everyone.
Quite the off the wall movie, fun!  Don't know if I would call this a guys movie because I liked it too.
The movie is not what I expected.  I rate it just so-so and would not recommend buying it.  Very disappointed.

Paul Gross is probably Canada's biggest booster.  Every project he works in he promotes Canadian talent.  That's great when the writing is on target.  It's not so great if it's mediocre.  My sons laughed uproariously throughout, but I found it only mildly funny.

This sweet li'l western is my favorite. There's a morality tale involved, but it doesn't clobber one over the head. Paul Gross is awesome!!! I so want to see him do more westerns. Sienna Guillory is gutsy and gorgeous and the rest of the cast are equally competent. If you liked Due South, you'll probably like seeing how Paul Gross has matured. I'd buy it again.

This movie surprised me, I laughed out loud so many times.  I don't really care for westerns, but I have re-watched this movie enough times that I bought my own copy.

The Montana Kid, a wanted gunslinger, is chased into Canada by four bounty hunters.  The Kid arrives in a small town where no one carries a side arm or abides by "The Code of the West".  The Kid over-reacts to almost everything he sees as the residents of the sleepy little town just go about their normal eccentic business.  The story reminds me of the 1960's "Maverick" TV show with James Garner.  There is a parody of the classic western shootout from a bath tub, with a very funny result.  The movie builds up to an inevitable comic shootout when the bounty hunters arrive and the movie's ending leaves me feeling good.

The scenery in the Canadian Rockies is beautiful.  The DVD does not have many extra features besides multi-language subtitles.  There are bloopers included in the end credits that are hilarious.
it was a serious,funny,unusual western;;;;;pleasant to watch with a good ending.easy and interesting to watch,the ending  had a very good point to it.

Paul Gross is a fantastic actor and gorgeous on top of it but everyone in this film was right on. I loved this production. It reminded me of Due South but with just a nod to it...which is so Canandian. I loved the comedy and the satire and wish that it would become a series . Canada comes up with the best actors and the best stories but rarely gets it's due. Hollywood should be so lucky as to have the talent that Canada offers. Mr. Gross has been a dedicated supporter of Canadian Media when he ,most certainlycould be a huge "Star" in the "Hollywood Star Mill".Watch this movie and be sure to rate it....we can only hope that excellence will be rewarded!
Love this movie.  Good family humor and fun.  Typical Canadian humor and poking fun at the differences between the American and Canadian cultures.

I must confess a certain disappointment with this film; I thought it was a comedy.  In the strictest sense of that word, it isn't.  Instead, Gunless veers clumsily between uncertainty and a definite lack of commitment to a specific style (one minute slapstick with a sword, the next minute shooting a boy's dog).  I found this peculiar blend of humor and a vain attempt to produce an old-fashioned western off-putting.  Even more disconcerting, and for no reason at all, the movie is also peppered with songs!  Paul Gross, who I normally like, does little more than pose and provide service as straight man to every loon thinking to set up a joke.  I cringed rather than chuckle.  This strange little movie doesn't work as a parody, satire, or a serious western.  But the worst offense was wasting the considerable talents of Graham Greene, reduced to sitting on a horse and saying very little.  Even a stand-in could have done his job!  I was less than impressed.  Viewing this was just a notch above ordeal.

When the "Montana Kid" accidentally drifts across the Canadian border, the kindness of the small-town settlers he meets prompts him to reconsider the violence of his life.  This little film is filled with wisdom and humor.
I didn't know either star until I chanced upon this movie late one night. The movie was funny and entertaining. I looked up the stars afterwards, and I now have a major crush on Ms Guillory!
I am a Paul Gross fan from his Due South days, also a western film fan.  Yay,  both in one film!  If you like quirky, this is it.
I like Paul Gross, because he is such a good actor, director, producer, and writer, and I also like the satire protrayed in the movie.
We could not get over how funny this movie is!  The gunslinger is hot...his sweetie is too! In fact, just about everything in this film is a giggle!
Product is good too. The DVD is in great condition. It is a great movie that is not only entertaining and funny, but CLEAN. You cannon find a movie like that anymore. I love this movie.

I am not a fan of westerns, but I am a fan of Paul gross so I figured I'd give this movie a try and I am glad I did! This movie was laugh out loud funny and a fun movie to watch with my husband. He really enjoyed it too! I was worried about how it would be since it was not rated and I am very conservative, but except for a few cuss words and one scene where two unmarried people wake up together, the movie is pretty clean. And quite frankly it's hard to find a really good movie that has no cuss words or unmarried people in bed.

If you are looking for something really funny, take a look.

Although not a screamer, this fine story follows a nasty gunslinger who stumbles into town on blind "luck" from a hangin'.  And fortunately, the town's north of the border and full of friendly Canadians that take him in as almost one of their own.  The writing and dialogue is brisk, original, concise, and funny.  For those of you who have visited Canada and truly enjoy the people, this is a MUST see.

The movie is very well made, written, and executed.  No, I am not a critic but I grow tired of unfunny/low quality junk made these days.  This is NOT one of those.  The music and everything else work together perfectly.  At whatever budget for this show was, it was spent very wisely.

And finally, the show's story is nice with just enough sweetener to be refreshing.

Well done!  I wish there were more like this.

Fun and entertaining video, recommend it highly.  Unique approach to a western, and the
actors all did a great job.

GREAT MOVIE!!!  It's one that I would recommend to my mother.  Good, clean fun and funny, with a few life lessons thrown in to boot.  I'm a fan of westerns (John Wayne, Sam Elliott, Tom Selleck, and now I'll add Paul Gross to the list).  They did a great job with this movie.  Turns out it's hard be a bad guy in a town full of good people (even if they are Canadian and crazy).  Definitely worth adding to your movie collection!

Gunless is something I decided to stream one night.  Much to my surprise the movie was good.  This prompted me to look on Amazon for a deal.

First of all it is funny.  The humor is not always in your face, other times it is.  The story is simply a gun fighter trying to turn his life around.  He meets the town widow and starts falling in love with her and the peaceful town.

Second there is action.  The story builds up at the end with a big gun fight.  All the while the gun slinger has been trying to forget his past, yet he does have to use his gun to save the town and himself.  Not in the way you might think.  He shots not to kill.

Loved the movie and everyone that has watched it with me enjoyed it too.

Paul Gross plays a gunslinger, the Montana Kid in this near western. Paul reminds me of the Mel Gibson of yore, before he became Mr. Hyde. The Kid rides into town tied backward to his horse dragging a broken limb behind him. A young girl who speak-e English-e helps him down. The town graciously accepts him into their Canadian community, in spite of his uncouth ways. The general store doesn't carry a lot, but they can order stuff. It does have tea and escargot.

He ends up living with a woman and helping her build a windmill for her well until the action starts.

It is a good quirky movie. It is not a great western. It is not a great drama. It is not a great comedy. It spoofs the life of the old west and its "codes."

Parental Guide: No f-bombs, no nudity, no sex.

This Canadian movie was a rare delight. Set in the old west, it deals with the cultural differences between America and Canada as they may have existed at the time. Well written and wonderfully acted.  Beautiful scenery and a great sound track.  This movie will make you laugh out loud!
Good solid humor, both physical and verbal.  Not a "classic western", minimal violence, no nudity, limited cursing.  I liked it well enough to order a copy to send to my parents.
This is just a fun movie.  Couldn't be more different than "Due South", but has the same subtle humor.  Even has a happy ending.  Enjoy.

I liked this movie.
I had no idea what to expect, but the movie came off for me after I decided to just let it flow.
It isn't serious, but it isn't slapstick either. It's subtle humor bordered on not-quite-serious situations, and the viewer somewhat gradually realizes it all...like I said, just let it flow.

I won't go into the plot much, but I will ask: Remember the old american TV show Green Acres? Actor Eddie Albert plays attorney-turned-farmer Oliver Wendell Douglas, who moves to a town where he is the only sane man in a community of quirky characters. They, including Oliver's wife, somehow all understand each other despite their quirks and the surreal situations... That is what struck me about the Montana Kid's (Paul Gross) experience in the frontier Canadian town. He comes in, wounded and on the run. And with his "Code of the West" mentality from the wild-west USA, he is quickly determined to shoot it out w/ the local blacksmith who 'insulted' him. Problem is, nobody in town has a working pistol. What to do ?!?
The Code forbids the Kid to shoot an unarmed man outright, and you don't "quick-draw at high noon" with a shotgun or a rifle...But I called a showdown, dammit! A matter of honor - I can't call it off!

The townspeople don't understand, or perhaps more accurately, don't care about the conventions of his "code". What happens? The Kid ends up like a youngster at a family get-together. Ever go to one, where an older kid chases the younger ones? "Arggggh!!" he goes, being the mock-monster. "Yahhgggg!!!" the smaller kids scream, running away in semi-mock fright. Eventually they run to a parent or adult: "So-and-so is CHASING me!!!" The adult's calm reply: "Well, just don't run and he CAN'T chase you".
That's the Kid's humorous dilemma. He wants to 'chase', like the bigger kid at the family gathering, but this obscure little town just won't 'run' like he's used to! And the quirky characters, with their almost-Green Acres-like understandings of each other, largely dismiss him as a danger. Thus the rug is pulled out from underneath the Kid.

My favorite points: I got a kick out of the Kid periodically saying "What is WRONG with these people??" in that exasperated gravely/growly voice. Also the scene where he asks someone "Is the whole country insane, or is it just this town??". I also liked it when they discovered his real name (Sean? or some such) and started calling him that...Paul Gross was GREAT.

Least favorite parts:  The part where he's encircled by Mounties that beat him at the dance. This stepped a bit out of the realm of the comedic 'box' the film had developed up to that point IMHO.  (Admittedly, I may have missed something there, but regardless, it was quickly resolved by the later scenes)... I also didn't feel the dog being killed by the bounty hunters quite fit in.

Don't misunderstand - this movie is not on the highly surreal level of Green Acres; but it still requires that "suspension of disbelief" to enjoy it. Its not hard though - just let it flow...

I liked it, and look forward to getting the DVD.
--Chem.
(PS - you don't like this type of humor? Well, remember what Eddie Albert once said about the silliness of Green Acres: "It was over the heads of most people...":)

Westerns are not usually my thing, but I'm happy I came across this film. It is not big budget or in any way impressive, but it is a lot of fun.

The Montana Kid (Paul Gross) has a bit of a problem: he smells like a pigsty, he has a bullet in his backside, and he's narrowly escaped a hanging... and is dragging the tree branch behind him. While he is unconscious, his horse wanders across the Canadian border and winds up in a small town where no one seems to be armed. What he wants most is to get out of there, but he can't... because the local blacksmith has insulted him by calling him "common." The Montana Kid just can't stand for that kind of an insult, so he challenges the man to a gunfight. Problem is, no one has a revolver... except for Jane Taylor (Sienna Guillory), and she will only give him the rusted piece of metal if he helps her get her windmill up and working.

Her revolver has seen better days. In fact, when he picks it up, the handle falls off. But you cannot just ride out of town when you have challenged someone to a duel, so he sets about fixing it and waiting for parts. Never mind there is a posse on his tail. Never mind that the townspeople are all very curious about him. Never mind that he is running up a tab at the local store/tea house. A man's gotta do what a man's gotta do, even if it means being himself instead of the Montana Kid.

I'll put it right out there: at times, this movie is stupid, but since it is not trying to be anything but stupid, it works. It is a fun-loving western that does not take its characters, setting, or dialogue too seriously. Instead, it offers us humorous clichs and tongue in cheek characterization: the trigger-happy gunslinger, the local man obsessed with a stump he can't pull out, the bickering store owners, the Chinese family that can't speak a word of English, and the Canadian Mounted Officer who can't quote the rules just right. It isn't hilarious, but it is amusing and the cast is not half bad. There are moments the dialogue sticks but for the most part, I was having too much fun to care. It is mostly contained in a western town, but there is an impressive gunfight (that starts by accident) and some beautiful costumes going for it. The score is also cheeky in all the right ways.

Westerns (or indeed, any kind of film) that are appropriate for younger audiences are hard to find, but this is one of them. It is not perfect, but it is also not a kid's movie. It never feels childish or convoluted, and there are some meaningful scenes in it, as the Kid comes to realize that he doesn't have to fight. He can walk away if he wants to, even if it means dealing with the remorse of his past actions. It is not an award-winning production, but it does what it sets out to do: entertain.

What can I say that has not already been said?

Story line is interesting, Actors are all first rate, production quality is excellent. Perhaps the most underappreciated movies of recent films.

This is a very funny movie set in the old West, er, North. It centers on an American gunfighter that just cant seem to get a fight going no matter how hard he tries. Its full of kooky characters that you cant help but like. It's a lot of subtle humor much like a British comedy. This is one of those movies that you just cant help but like. There is a common sense message here that is the underlying theme of the movie.

This has the potential to become a cult classic. It has become one of my favorite movies. As a matter of fact I stopped by Amazon to pick up 3 copies of the DVD, one for me and two as gifts.

It's a shame I'm not a skilled writer, this movies deserves a better review than I can post. Do yourself a favor, check out this movie.

This movie is a favorite now.  It is funny and has a good message.  Mostly though, it is not something I have to work at watching.  I don't need to pick it apart or work hard to find some hidden dramatic meaning.  It's purely entertaining, which is what I generally like in movies.  The characters and the actors who play them are great - diverse in personality.  Melodie Choi is just about the cutest kid I've ever seen in a movie and a good actor as well.  And Paul Gross -- well aside from the good acting, has a voice that is perfect for the character.  A few familiar faces are in this movie, but mostly actors who are relatively new to movies and/or not usually seen in the US movie market.  The only negative thing I can say about it is the language in the outtakes during the end credits.  Otherwise it couldn't be better.  It's good fun and I highly recommend it to just about anyone.  Paul Gross's character is a gunslinger and does talk about the eleven people he's killed, so parents might want to monitor that and "guide" any young children.  I, personally, would have no problem allowing younger kids to watch this, with that guidance.

This is an odd and unpredictable, almost anti-Western film made by those quirky Canadians.  It takes place some time in the northwest, not quite the wild west, and features a town whose inhabitants would rather not use guns even though a gunslinger who arrives would like to do just that.

I'm not usually one to go out of my way to watch a western, but this one looked just quirky enough to maybe be worth a look.

In this show a notorious gunfighter, "The Montana Kid", flees north to escape a team of bounty hunters.  He rides into a small western town and promptly keels over.  He has been shot in an unfortunate spot -- you'll have to watch to find out where.  Anyway, shortly after coming to and wandering around the town, crossing paths with nearly everyone in short order he "has words" with the local blacksmith, and "The Kid" demands satisfaction.  He "calls him out", after the code of the old west.  Well, there's one big problem...the smith doesn't own a handgun.  The Kid can't believe it.  In his book you can't be a man unless you carry a gun and know how to use it.  What he didn't realize is that when he rode north he entered Canada, and happened into a small town of about 17 people...none of whom wears a gun.  He can't believe it!  And he then finds himself stranded in town until he can heal well enough to move on, that is, after he has a gunfight with the smith.

I found this entire scenario to be hilarious!  I watched it all the way through, wondering what mishap could happen next.

If you like shows like "Rustler's Rhapsody" or even "Quigley Down Under" then you will like this one.  It's more comedy and romantic comedy than it is western.  But, whatever it is, it's got the right balance of what it takes to hold an audience.

I'm truly glad I didn't miss it!

5 stars for this understated comedy that I hope will soon fly above the radar!
We have recently become familiar with Paul Gross.  He is so much fun to watch, in this movie and other shows.  We thoroughly enjoyed this movie and intend to watch it again with friends and family.

I watched this on Netflix the other day and was not expecting much from it... I am happy to say that it caught me off guard. There was a great blend of action, humor, and plot (something that seems to be missing from today movies). I am adding this to my wish list!

Oh those kooky Canadians. Leave it to them to come up with this way out of left field movie. I suppose this sort of "fish out of water" thing has been done before, but this is so lively and fresh it just plain feels brand new.

Here's the scoop. Paul Gross, after dodging a hanging, finds himself in some bust-out Canadian town. He's on his horse, but he's been shot in the butt, rolled around in pig doo-doo and tied up. A long time bounty hunter/adversary is on his tail as he finds himself with an odd assortment of towns people who he must stay with (for at least a while) before he can get back on his horse and ride. It's that "at least a while" part that ends up messing with his head.

This movie is a real hoot. It's peppered with an oddball bunch of characters and somehow the goofy plot line makes its own kind of sense. They're such a crazy bunch they create a good juxtaposition to Gross's character. Yes he's killed men. Many men. But he's not a bad guy. His sense of right and wrong just somehow got out of hand. Now he meets a girl to whom he's indebted and he starts to realize that the constant running, and his sense of justice, might not be the best way to live. It almost plays out out like an episode of the "Andy Griffith Show."

It's set in a sparse part of Canada in a small town so the budget must have been manageable. But it doesn't look cheap. It's shot well and all the actors, even the secondary ones, do a really good job. You love these people and want to be with them. The music is good as well. There are a couple of quirky, tongue in cheek, tunes that help keep things light. This seems to be taking place in the late 19th century, but the language and many of the sensibilities are strictly "now." I don't know squat about Paul Gross but he handles his role extremely well. He's created a very memorable character. He reminds me a great deal of Josh Brolin. Sienna Guillroy is the love interest and she's quite fetching. These two make a fine pair.

I cannot say enough about this movie. There is no wasted time here. It moves at a decent clip and will not test your sense of time. It's as entertaining as a movie can be and it has a good heart without being cheezy. I had the time of my life watching it and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.
Gunless is a canadian western with a bit of humor, romance and some excitment. I enjoyed this very much as they don't make any good westerns anymore.

Not at the farcial level of Mel Brooke's "Blazing Saddles", but full of tongue in cheek, and slapstick humor plus winking, cultural commentary, Gunless is a lot of fun!

Paul Gross(quite well known in Canada, I remember him from the "Red Green Show") plays a, set in his ways, American gunslinger that flees into a bucolic, Canadian town being chased by, ever getting nearer, bounty hunters.  He gets in a huff with the local, giant of a man, blacksmith and determines to have it out with him if, and a big if, he can find a working six shooter for the showdown.

He takes a job, a trade off, put up a windmill for a gun, with a pretty but struggling rancher, Sienna Guillory("Inkhart", "Resident Evil").  The townfold are quirky and charming and with the woman do there best to distract him from his plan.

It's well shot and scripted, nice scenery, and there's enough seriousness to it to keep it more in reality than just being a constant joke; moreover, the hero and heroine provide a sweet, developing, but at odds, romance.  My wife won't watch a western unless there's some hint of romance or at least a woman in it.

It's not quite full family fare: the baddies shoot a dog, threaten townfolk, attempt a hanging, but overall, the violence is controlled and made fun of, the language, except for the outtakes, minimum; there's no nudity or sex, one implied encounter, and all things work out for the best with a moral about living peacefully.

Summary, a feel good movie, an unusual, comedic western, that also pokes light fun at cultural differences between US and Canada.

I bought this DVD unseen because I am a Paul Gross Fan.  It's a very funny film.  Fans of Paul Gross won't be disappointed.  Along with the humor there are some very thought provoking scenes.  I bought a new DVD from a third-party seller.  Very satisfied.  Promptly delivererd, played beautifully.

It's silly at times, but I loved this movie. I am a big fan of Paul gross from Due South. He plays this role very well, with his gravely voice and acting skills he could do a serious western very easily.

then you will like Gunless. Gunless is a calm, earnest and very funny western comedy. The characters are interesting and varied. I fell in love with the whole town.
The storyline is pretty basic - gunfighter with a twitchy trigger finger stumbles into town ahead of the bounty hunters after him. He takes offense at a supposed slight (the blacksmith was looking after his horse without permission)and challenges the blacksmith to a duel. Can't duel because there isn't another pistol in the entire town. There are shotguns and rifles but not a single working pistol. There is a broken pistol...
So there is the introduction to the townsfolk, all of them have an interesting quirk or two, and the meet-cute between the gunfighter and the lady who will be his salvation. The gunfighter is welcomed into the community while he struggles to fix the pistol.
The climax is the duel/shootout at the end. Absolutely hilarious! The bloopers in the end credits are just as entertaining. The extras are well worth the time to view as well. It just looked like they had fun on that set. After all they are The Good, The Bad, The Canadian.

Paul Gross plays a gunslinger, the Montana Kid in this near western. Paul reminds me of the Mel Gibson of yore, before he became Mr. Hyde. The Kid rides into town tied backward to his horse dragging a broken limb behind him. A young girl who speak-e English-e helps him down. The town graciously accepts him into their Canadian community, in spite of his uncouth ways. The general store doesn't carry a lot, but they can order stuff. It does have tea and escargot.

He ends up living with a woman and helping her build a windmill for her well.

It is a good movie. It is not a great western. It is not a great drama. It is not a great comedy. It spoofs the life of the old west and its "codes." No f-bombs, no nudity, no sex.
As others, I bought this because I enjoy Paul Gross' work, and westerns. This was a very enjoyable movie. I have recommended it to friends.

My family loves this movie! It's lighthearted and very funny, with touches of British wit and humor. Paul Gross is spot on; his talent as an actor allows him to believably morph into any character he portrays. The people of Barclay's Brush, totally unprepared to accept the ways of the "American wild west;" offer a chance for redemption to The Montana Kid through acceptance; genuine care and concern. For American audiances Alliance Films also brought us "Due South." A fine cast of supporting actors; Sienna Guillory, Callum Keith Rennie (the second Ray from Due South) Dustin Milligan and Graham Greene. I would highly recommend it's purchase; as just an overall good family movie.
My eleven year old and thirteen year old really enjoyed this movie as did I.  It is just a plain old fashioned fun movie.

I bought Gunless because I like Paul Gross' work and I wanted to see his new movie. It didn't disappoint. Gunless has a very funny premise: Injured American gunfighter on the run arrives in a Canadian border town, challenges the blacksmith to a gun duel, discovers that there are no working pistols in the town, and has to wait around for days for parts to repair the only pistol before he can kill the poor man.  It's a great twist on a basic Western movie plot. Paul Gross does a very good job as The Montana Kid. He has excellent comedic timing and plays the character as a decent, too serious, frustrated man who has lost his way.  There is a sweet romance, but not too much to turn off the guys in the audience.  Sienna Guillory is a wonderful foil for Gross' comedy and, along with the rest of the ensemble, projects an innocent inability to understand this American's need for dueling and revenge.  The actors all have a wonderful talent for comedy, the Alberta setting is gorgeous, and the ending is very satisfactory.  This movie doesn't pretend to be great art, but it's a whole lot of fun.  I highly recommend it. (By the way, I understand that this may be the only Canadian Western in existence. It has an all Canadian cast, I think, and you can tell they had fun making.)
What a waste of talent in this movie, watched it once and put in the back of the closet

The movie is entertaining. Subtle humor and character development are two things I enjoy. This is also a great movie to watch with the whole family as there is little objectionable content (one scene may be disturbing for young viewers when a dog is shot, and two characters do engage in sex (off-screen) and wake up together) and clean language (the word "ass" is used a couple of times). However, I wish the DVD had closed-captioning. I am hard of hearing and while I can turn up the TV, the way Paul Gross tends to mumble his words makes them difficult to understand. Overall, though, the film itself is enjoyable. It's the product that could just use the improvement of closed-captioning to make it better.
Beautifully shot, good character development, intelligent and subtle humor.  And Canadian!  Yay!
Very enjoyable movie.  Not so bad guy learns a good lesson.
Very  funny movie, obvious and subtle humor.  No vulgarity.  Highly recommend it.

I came across this a couple years ago on Netflix.  This movie is hilarious.  Kinda like satire, but not cheesy by any means.  A fun Western that my mom, dad, wife and I all enjoyed.  Commedic enough to hold everyone's attention. Amazon is the only place I found it.  I know it is a Canadian film, but plays on USA equipment no problem.
This is so funny!!
Great Movie!

If you like offbeat ironic humor, coupled with compelling characters, this is your movie.  I accidentally happened upon it, had never heard of it, had  no experience with any of the actors, and perhaps that was part of the charm.  It is a good family movie, and definitely worth the price I paid for the nights entertainment.
Great movie!
Another wonderful tale of love, murder and mystery. I loved every second. Prepare yourself to watch the Old West gunfight like you've never seen it before. Great actors.
